definition: hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: " At least, "Monroe Doctrine" is the United States, the important principle of regional hegemony.
sentences.chinese: 至少“门罗主义”是美国的地区霸权主义的重要原则。

sentences.english: Hegemonism and power politics have new manifestations.
sentences.chinese: 霸权主义和强权政治有新的表现。

sentences.english: The terrorism and hegemonism are the two big historical persistent ailments that the human society faces.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖主义和霸权主义是人类社会面临的两大历史顽症。

sentences.english: Hegemonism has been embedded in the mind of some American politicians.
sentences.chinese: 霸权主义思想已深深印入某些美国政客的脑海。

sentences.english: Second, China opposes hegemonism and upholds world peace.
sentences.chinese: 第二，中国反对霸权主义，维护世界和平。

sentences.english: The arms race is rooted in the hegemonist policy of the superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 军备竞赛的根源在于超级大国的霸权主义政策。

sentences.english: On the international scene, the struggle against hegemonism has grown and the hegemonists are increasingly isolated.
sentences.chinese: 国际上，反霸斗争更加发展，霸权主义更加孤立。

sentences.english: It pursues a hegemonist line and policy in foreign relations.
sentences.chinese: 他们在对外关系上奉行的是霸权主义的路线和政策。

sentences.english: To work for peace one must oppose hegemony and power politics .
sentences.chinese: 要争取和平就必须反对霸权主义，反对强权政治。

sentences.english: Hegemonism and power politics still exist.
sentences.chinese: 霸权主义和强权政治依然存在。

definition: nationalism/national self-determination/principle of nationalism, the first of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning parity between China and the great powers)/racism
